headline: Uber Technologies (UBER) Partners With Lyft and Baidu to Launch Driverless Taxi Trials in UK
summary: Uber Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:UBER) is one of the Best Affordable Stocks to Buy According to Analysts. On December 22, Reuters reported that companies including Uber Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:UBER), Lyft, and Chinese Baidu have partnered to launch driverless taxi trials in the UK by next year. As a result of this partnership, Baidu’s Apollo Go RT6 […]

headline: 2026 will be 'year of autonomous': Analyst on Tesla, Waymo robotaxis
summary: 2026 is on the road to being the "year of autonomous" driving as Tesla (TSLA) and the Alphabet-owned Waymo (GOOG, GOOGL) seek to expand their robotaxi services to other major US cities. Wedbush Securities managing director of equity research Scott Devitt weighs in on the biggest themes and investing plays around self-driving technology, and how he sees 2026 playing out for rideshare companies Uber (UBER) and Lyft (LYFT). Catch Scott Devitt's top three consumer internet stock picks heading into 2026. Also watch Yahoo Finance's interview with University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign associate professor Katherine Driggs-Campbell about the recent behavior shifts in autonomous vehicles' driving habits To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: 2026 will be 'year of autonomous': Analyst on Tesla, Waymo robotaxis
content.description:
2026 is on the road to being the "year of autonomous" driving as Tesla (TSLA) and the Alphabet-owned Waymo (GOOG, GOOGL) seek to expand their robotaxi services to other major US cities.

Wedbush Securities managing director of equity research Scott Devitt weighs in on the biggest themes and investing plays around self-driving technology, and how he sees 2026 playing out for rideshare companies Uber (UBER) and Lyft (LYFT).

Catch Scott Devitt's top three consumer internet stock picks heading into 2026.

Also watch Yahoo Finance's interview with University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign associate professor Katherine Driggs-Campbell about the recent behavior shifts in autonomous vehicles' driving habits

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
